note.p: Career: Practised in Trevaux (1707); went to Paris to study with Tournefort (1708); Professor of Botany, Jardin des Plantes (1710); travelled in France, Spain and Portugal to collect plants; practised in Paris
Proposers: Sir Hans Sloane; Robert Ball
References: A Rupert Hall, 'Further Newton Correspondence' in NR 1982-83 vol 37 pp 7-34
Jean Jacquot, 'Sir Hans Sloane and French Men of Science' in NR 1953 vol 10 pp 85-98
